speaker: NURSE
line: How ya doin' hon? Breathe deeply...just like that... there you go. You're doing great!

speaker: AMANDA
line: Yeah. Real great.

speaker: SECOND NURSE
line: Ma'am...ma'am I need your full name and Social Security number.

speaker: AMANDA
line: Amanda Nelligan. 545250809.

speaker: SECOND NURSE
line: And your insurance carrier?

speaker: AMANDA
line: Atlantic Mutual.

speaker: SECOND NURSE
line: Great. Now is there anyone we need to contact? The father of the baby?

speaker: AMANDA
line: I'm not sure I can get a hold of him.

speaker: SECOND NURSE
line: If you give me his name I can try.

speaker: AMANDA
line: He's not from around here.

speaker: SECOND NURSE
line: Is he from out of state?

speaker: AMANDA
line: Another planet.

speaker: NURSE
line: All right, we're here now. Okay, hold on.

speaker: DR ALTON PUGH
line: One more push. There we go. We're going to set a speed record here. There's a cute face. Bulb syringe. This is like the Indy 500 here. Here it comes - the shoulder. Good. Okay Amanda, that'll do it..

speaker: DR PUGH
line: Oh.

speaker: OR NURSE
line: God.

speaker: AMANDA
line: What? What is it?

speaker: DR PUGH
line: It's okay. She's just fine. Perfectly healthy. No problem. Everything's going to be a-okay. You've got a healthy baby girl.

speaker: DR PUGH
line: Good Lord... not another one.

speaker: MULDER
line: I admit the photo's a little over the top, but uh, what do you think Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, seriously.

speaker: MULDER
line: Children born with vestigial tails don't interest you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Caudal appendages. Fetuses have them. Their coccyx enlargens to contain the spinal fluid and then it shrinks as the child develops. Occasionally, it doesn't. It's extremely rare, but it has been known to happen.

speaker: MULDER
line: Five times within the last three months, all in a town with a population of less than 15,000 people? I'd say that's a little more than a statistical anomaly.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So would I. No, Mulder I think you're right, I think that something about this definitely warrants investigation. Only not by us. I'd say that it's a job for the local health department.

speaker: MULDER
line: I called around. They're already investigating.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So uh, so what else about this interests you? Could it be Virginia Women Mate with Visitors from Space?")... visitors from space?

speaker: AMANDA
line: The doctor said that my baby, she's gonna be fine. She's really healthy. Once she gets to be a few months old, it's just a matter of a snip.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's good to hear.

speaker: AMANDA
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you experience any unusual complications during your pregnancy, Amanda? Did you undergo any kind of fertility treatment?

speaker: AMANDA
line: No. I wasn't trying to get pregnant. I guess you could just sort of say I'm a single mom now.

speaker: MULDER
line: When you were admitted you said that the baby's father was from another planet. What did you mean by that exactly?

speaker: AMANDA
line: You know, that he's not from this planet.

speaker: MULDER
line: Were you abducted?

speaker: AMANDA
line: Huh? No, no, he dropped by my apartment one day, and one thing sort of led to another..

speaker: MULDER
line: But the baby's father is an alien?

speaker: AMANDA
line: No, no, I didn't say he was an alien, I said he was from another planet. His name is Luke Skywalker. He's what's known as a Jedi Knight.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did he have a light saber?

speaker: AMANDA
line: No, he didn't bring it. He did sing me a song for me though. Da dum da da da da dum...

speaker: SCULLY
line: How many times have you seen Star Wars, Amanda?

speaker: AMANDA
line: Three hundred and sixty eight. I should break four hundred by Memorial Day.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay. Thank you.

speaker: AMANDA
line: Oh wait a minute, wait. You know these four other babies that were born around here with tails?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh huh.

speaker: AMANDA
line: There couldn't be any chance Luke's the father, is there?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay. All right, I got it. Thank you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Take your best shot, Scully, but I think there's more going on here than Luke Skywalker and his light saber.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think you're right, Mulder. Coming?

speaker: HEALTH DEPARTMENT DOCTOR
line: Here are the PCR's we ran of the five children. We put calls into the parents. We'll blood test all the husbands hopefully by this afternoon, just to double check.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Good.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: They'll be none too happy. I have to confess, this answer seems so strangely obvious, I probably wouldn't have even checked for it.

speaker: MULDER
line: What answer?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You see here, these identical band trait matches all showing a small loss of a part of chromosome number eight? Each of these five children, born to five different women, all share the same father.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I should have thought of it sooner. This kind of appended birth defect is often passed on within a family.

speaker: MULDER
line: Meaning the father had a tail as well?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Though he most likely had it surgically removed somewhere along the way.

speaker: MULDER
line: How would this happen?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Birds and the bees and the monkey babies, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Birds do it, bees do it, even educated MD's do it. All five of these women shared the same OB-GYN, didn't they?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well yeah, he's the only one in town.

speaker: MULDER
line: And four of the five women, the four married women not including Amanda Nelligan, were on record as receiving insemination therapy as a means of conception.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So you're thinking that the doctor might have something to do with it.

speaker: MULDER
line: So much for not putting all your eggs in one basket.

speaker: FRED
line: Baboo, look. Just let me handle it, okay?

speaker: BABOO
line: I think we should find the best lawyer we can because I definitely plan to sue. That's all I'm saying, Fred.

speaker: FRED
line: Baboo look, just let me do the talking. All right?

speaker: BABOO
line: Okay. Just tell him we're going to sue.

speaker: FRED
line: Oh! You too, huh?

speaker: FRED
line: What the hell did you do?

speaker: BABOO
line: Yeah, Alton!

speaker: OTHER VOICES
line: Yeah! What did you do?

speaker: DR ALTON
line: I didn't do anything. Now folks, we're going to figure this out here, I promise. Look, everybody just relax.

speaker: FRED
line: Don't you tell me to relax. What the hell happened to my sperm?

speaker: MAN #2
line: Yeah mine too!

speaker: WOMAN #2
line: Whose did you use?

speaker: MAN #2
line: It's bad enough having a boy with a tail and you find out it's not even yours! For God's sake Alton, how many of us are there?

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh, I'm Special Agent Mulder with the Federal Bureau of Investigation, and this is Agent Scully.

speaker: FRED
line: Great! Arrest this son of a bitch.

speaker: MAN #2
line: Yeah, arrest this guy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Settle down, nobody's going to be arrested.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, we're just here to find out what's going on.

speaker: FRED
line: Alton didn't use my sperm.

speaker: DR ALTON
line: I most certainly did. Each of you women was inseminated with your husband's own sperm, and nobody else's.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why was it necessary to inseminate in these cases?

speaker: DR ALTON
line: It was a sperm motility issue. The intrauterine process that I used has about a 40% chance of success. I was surprised, it seemed to work all four times. Now the only thing I can think of is...

speaker: MAN #3
line: What?

speaker: DR ALTON
line: Maybe it never worked at all.

speaker: BABOO
line: What are you saying, Alton?

speaker: FRED
line: Honey...

speaker: BABOO
line: No, I want to know what he means by that. I haven't been with a man since 1989, I mean not counting you.

speaker: DR ALTON
line: Look, I'm not accusing anyone of anything. I'm just saying this latest patient of mine who just gave birth to a baby with a tail, she didn't even undergo insemination. So you folks are blaming the wrong baby doctor!

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey.

speaker: EDDIE
line: Hey.

speaker: MULDER
line: Excuse me. I'm an agent with the Federal Bureau of Investigation. I'd like to ask you a few questions.

speaker: EDDIE
line: Uh, yeah okay.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, check it out.

speaker: WOMAN #2
line: Oh my God.

speaker: WOMAN #3
line: It's him? He's the one?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Five out of five.

speaker: EDDIE
line: They spelled my name wrong. It's Van Blundht with a silent "H". B-l-u-n-d-H-t.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, we'll get right on that.

speaker: EDDIE
line: Lots of people spell it wrong. It's like Dutch or something. Can I go now?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. There's a few things we have to clear up first.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. Like how'd you do it?

speaker: EDDIE
line: What do you mean, how'd I do it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're the father of five children Mr Van Blundht. Is that not news to you? Do you have any insight into how five women came to be inseminated with your sperm?

speaker: EDDIE
line: You make it sound so romantic.

speaker: MULDER
line: So you're saying there was romance involved?

speaker: EDDIE
line: Why is that so hard to believe? Just cause I was born with a tail no woman would want me? Maybe I got...personality. Ever think of that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You had sex with these women? How is it that none of them have any recollection whatsoever of that happening?

speaker: EDDIE
line: Look, I'm not saying anything one way or another. I'm just saying hypothetically, if some women wanted to have kids, their husbands weren't...capable, and everybody was happy and no one got hurt, well hypothetically, where's the crime?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, if you're waiting for my usual theory as to what's going on, I don't have one.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I do. On, uh, on behalf of all the women in the world, I seriously doubt this is anything to do with consensual sex. I think it involved some form of Rohypnol rape.

speaker: MULDER
line: A tranquilizer? I didn't think of that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's been called the date rape drug. High doses of it cause a loosening of inhibitions, memory loss. Now if Van Blundht was somehow able to slip the drug to these women especially in conjunction with alcohol...

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but when and where would he have had the opportunity to slip it to them?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well he identified these women through his janitorial job at the medical park. He could have followed them anywhere, to a club, to a bar.

speaker: MULDER
line: Those women don't look like the type that do a lot of solo drinking.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think it's enough to keep him in custody while we check it out.

speaker: EDDIE
line: Uh, you spelled my name wrong. It's B-l-u-n-d-H-t. Silent "H".

speaker: DEPUTY
line: Address. I strongly suggest you stop eyeballing me and tell me your address.

speaker: EDDIE
line: Seventeen Prospect Parkway, Martinsburg, 25401.

speaker: DEPUTY
line: All right, Mr Van Blund-Ht. Give me your phone number.

speaker: DEPUTY
line: What the hell?

speaker: EDDIE AS DEPUTY
line: The H is silent.

speaker: OFFICER
line: I could have sworn Curtis clocked out hours ago. He said good night to me and everything. This morning I find him shoved underneath the desk.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Deputy, are you sure you don't remember what happened last night?

speaker: DEPUTY
line: The guy coldcocked me. Except he wasn't the guy. He was me. My head hurts.

speaker: MULDER
line: I found Van Blundht's clothes in the locker room. He must have walked out of here wearing the deputy's spare uniform.

speaker: SCULLY
line: After hitting him over the head.

speaker: MULDER
line: I have a theory. Do you want to hear it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Van Blundht somehow physically transformed into his captor then walked out the door leaving no one the wiser?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey Scully, should we be picking out china patterns or what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, why can't you just go for the simple answer? With that blow to the head the deputy might just as well have identified McGruff the crime dog as his attacker.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about what the sheriff saw?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Two men, roughly the same build, same coloring. The addition of a uniform goes a long way to explain how one person can mistake one man for another at 3 o'clock in the morning.

speaker: MULDER
line: Conversely my theory goes a long way to explaining how four married women could mistake Van Blundht for their husbands, and how Amanda Nelligan could think it was Luke Skywalker. We've both seen something like this before, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But what are you saying, that that Van Blundht is an alien?

speaker: MULDER
line: Not unless they have trailer parks in space. This is something different.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey Scully, if you could be somebody else for a day, who would it be?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hopefully myself.

speaker: MULDER
line: So boring! I mean, wouldn't you even be tempted to try out someone else's existence for a day, live your life as somebody else?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Looking like someone else, Mulder, and being someone else are completely different things.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, maybe it's not, I mean everybody else around you would treat you like you were somebody else, and ultimately maybe it's other people's reactions to us that make us who we are.

speaker: SCULLY
line: All right, then. Eleanor Roosevelt.

speaker: MULDER
line: It can't be a dead person.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why the hell not?

speaker: MULDER
line: Because.

speaker: EDDIE AS EDDIE SR
line: What are you doing sneaking around my porch?

speaker: MULDER
line: We were uh...we're with the FBI. Is this the home of Edward Van Blundht?

speaker: EDDIE AS EDDIE SR
line: Yeah, that's me.

speaker: MULDER
line: We're looking for your son, Eddie junior.

speaker: EDDIE AS EDDIE SR
line: Eddie? What did that moron do now?

speaker: EDDIE AS EDDIE SR
line: Five women? Oh, Lord. Anything else?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. He, uh, attacked a sheriff's deputy during his escape from custody.

speaker: EDDIE AS EDDIE SR
line: Hurt bad?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Fortunately not.

speaker: EDDIE AS EDDIE SR
line: Well, thank heavens for that at least.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, do you have any idea where your son might be?

speaker: EDDIE AS EDDIE SR
line: I wish I did. I'm sorry. I haven't seen him for the last two days.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is this...is this you?

speaker: EDDIE AS EDDIE SR
line: One and the same! Hey, you want to see?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No! No. No thank you.

speaker: EDDIE AS EDDIE SR
line: My son had his removed when he was uh, just a kid. Kept bugging me and bugging me, till I finally let him do it. There you go.

speaker: EDDIE AS EDDIE SR
line: I told him it was a mistake. I said son, you ain't much to look at. You ain't no athlete, and you sure the hell ain't no Einstein. But at least you got that tail. Otherwise you're just small potatoes. But he didn't listen.

speaker: MULDER
line: Does your son have any other unique medical conditions, I mean, aside from the tail?

speaker: EDDIE AS EDDIE SR
line: Mr Mulder, that boy was born sickly. We used to have this condition down in the south called pellagra -

speaker: MULDER
line: Excuse me, sir, how did you know my name was Mulder?

speaker: EDDIE AS EDDIE SR
line: She told me it was.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh no, actually I didn't.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's him!

speaker: MULDER
line: Pretty spry for an old guy, huh?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Eddie junior, not senior.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, whichever one he is, wouldn't you say he's a man with a secret?

speaker: BABOO
line: Honey, what are you doing here so early?

speaker: BABOO
line: Fred?

speaker: BABOO
line: Honey? Fred, is everything okay?

speaker: EDDIE
line: Everything's fine.

speaker: BABOO
line: What happened to the clothes you were wearing this morning?

speaker: EDDIE
line: I'll explain later. Just give me a little privacy okay? Uh... Baboo.

speaker: BABOO
line: Okay, Sugar Patootie.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll check upstairs.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm all right!

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: Ohhh. It's quicklime. Move back over there.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not so spry. You think the fall killed him?

speaker: FRED
line: Baboo! I'm home!

speaker: EDDIE
line: Oh...crap.

speaker: FRED
line: I'm home early. What?

speaker: BABOO
line: You were just here. You went into the bathroom.

speaker: FRED
line: What?

speaker: FRED
line: Someone is in the bathroom!

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: It's all clear.

speaker: MULDER
line: So what killed Eddie the monkey man?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's difficult to say. The quicklime burned the tissue even as it preserved it, so what killed him is one of two things I haven't figured out yet.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's the other thing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That would be this. It's striated muscle tissue.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's unusual about that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: In and of itself, nothing. Where I found it however -

speaker: MULDER
line: Where did you find it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Everywhere. His entire body. As far as I can tell, this man has a thin stratum of voluntary muscle tissue underpinning the entire dermal layer of his skin. That's not normal. This man's body is quite a scientific specimen, and thankfully it's preserved and intact.

speaker: SCULLY
line: In other words, there are six hundred and fifty four muscles in the human body, and this man essentially has six hundred and fifty five.

speaker: MULDER
line: Um, could that somehow be related to his uh, having a tail?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Possibly. It could be a linked gene birth defect.

speaker: MULDER
line: What would be the, uh, purpose of, of this, uh...muscle?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You got me, Mulder. Maybe none. It appears to be atrophied, although it may look that way as a result of the mummification.

speaker: MULDER
line: Could this be a "like father like son" kind of a thing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh, could Eddie junior have, uh, the same anomalous muscular structure as his dad here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe. What are you suggesting?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, um, if this musculature underlies the entire skin, then maybe it could be utilized to remold the skin's shape and texture. Which would go a long way to explaining why we're looking for a man who can appear to be his own father, or anyone else for that matter.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Isn't it much more likely, Mulder, that this man simply has an identical twin?

speaker: MULDER
line: Check that out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are you going?

speaker: MULDER
line: Something about Van Blundht's MO confuses me. His victims were four married women who wanted to get pregnant...

speaker: SCULLY
line: ... and one single woman who didn't.

speaker: AMANDA
line: Come in!

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: Sorry, Ms. Nelligan. I'm sorry to bother you.

speaker: AMANDA
line: No, no, it's no bother.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: I just have uh, a few additional questions I wanted to ask you.

speaker: AMANDA
line: Okay.

speaker: NURSE
line: Here we go sweetie.

speaker: AMANDA
line: Bye bye!

speaker: NURSE
line: We'll just come back later.

speaker: AMANDA
line: You know, I thought they were letting me stay in the hospital so long because I have really, really great insurance. Turns out they're just keeping me here because they think I'm sort of crazy. They want to make sure I'm safe to be around my baby.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: Free cable. I want to ask you... do you recognize this man?

speaker: AMANDA
line: Ohhh...yes...eww. That's Eddie Van Blundht.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: What can you tell me about him?

speaker: AMANDA
line: We went out all through high school. Oh, brother...

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: What?

speaker: AMANDA
line: Nothing, he's just sort of a loser. He's one of those guys you look back on, you know, and oh my God, what was I thinking? WHAT was I thinking?

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: Well...what, uh, specifically made him a loser?

speaker: AMANDA
line: I don't know. Everything. He had like one million annoying personal habits. You know, just no sense of romance, no ambition, no direction. I mean, I hear he's like a janitor or something now. He had this weird family, his dad was in the circus or something. I don't know. He never let me meet him, thank God.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: He must have had some good qualities?

speaker: AMANDA
line: Well, yeah, sure, everybody's got a few. Yeah, we had some good times. We really loved Star Wars so we used to go and see it every weekend. That was nice. He was no Luke, that's for sure. Why do you want to know about Eddie?

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: That's official FBI business.

speaker: AMANDA
line: Wow!

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: I wanted to congratulate you on this... blessed event.

speaker: AMANDA
line: Thank you. May the force be with you!

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: Uh-huh.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm here to see Amanda Nelligan?

speaker: NURSE
line: Straight down the hall, there.

speaker: AMANDA
line: Come in! No, seriously though, why do you want to know about Eddie?

speaker: MULDER
line: What about Eddie?

speaker: AMANDA
line: Why were you asking me all those questions about him?

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: FRED
line: Agent Mulder, this is Fred Nieman. Is it okay for us to get into our bathroom now?

speaker: MULDER
line: Excuse me, sir?

speaker: FRED
line: Well, I was hoping we could get into our bathroom sometime this evening. You said the police were going to come by and dust it for some fingerprints but that was over four hours ago.

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh huh.

speaker: FRED
line: We want to help you catch this guy, but I gotta say I'm having a real hard time here. I mean, how exactly do you wind up chasing a suspect into my bathroom?

speaker: BABOO
line: Don't forget the suit.

speaker: FRED
line: And what do you need with my charcoal suit?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sorry Mr Nieman, I'm going to have to call you back. I was just here. Where did I go?

speaker: AMANDA
line: Huh?

speaker: MULDER
line: There was a man. He looked exactly like me. Did you see where he went?

speaker: NURSE
line: Down the hall... men's locker room.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thank you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey.

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: Hey.

speaker: MULDER
line: Van Blundht...

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: Who?

speaker: MULDER
line: Think about it. Get your hands up. Turn around.

speaker: MULDER
line: Keep them up there. Put your hands down now. If it's not you, I apologize in advance.

speaker: MAN
line: What are you doing?

speaker: MULDER
line: Pull your pants up.

speaker: DR PUGH
line: What? What did I do now?

speaker: MULDER
line: You're the only ones here?

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: I apologize. Only one of you is the man I'm looking for. I hope. I gotta wait for some blood tests to come back and then I'll release the other one. So why don't you just sit back and relax? Keep your clothes on, huh?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, hey, it's me. I think you should get down to the hospital right away, okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm on my way.

speaker: EDDIE
line: You're a damn good looking man.

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: I mean, you draw a gun on me. You handcuff me.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: I know what I did.

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: I take issue with that.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: I'm sorry.

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: I have a serious problem with that.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: I'm sorry.

speaker: DR PUGH
line: I still don't understand. Do we look like criminals to you?

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: Look, I said I...

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: Exactly. What the hell was on your mind?

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: I said I was sorry.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's going on?

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: Am I done here?

speaker: COP
line: Yeah. We've got enough description. Come on guys.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What the hell happened?

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: Van Blundht surprised me. He cold cocked me and then he got away.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You got a lead on him?

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: No, but the local authorites are already on the warpath for going after one of their own. They'll catch him eventually.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So what? That's it for us?

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: I know I dragged you out here Scully, but I'm beginning to think this whole thing is just a waste of time.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Now you think there's no X-File here?

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: No. No, I think the only thing here is uh... small potatoes.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hello? Hellooo!! Get me out of here!

speaker: MULDER
line: Hello! Hello! I'm down here! Help! a sandwich, an apple and an opened can of Perk cola.)

speaker: SKINNER
line: Which one of you wrote this?

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: I did, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You spelled Federal Bureau of Investigation wrong.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: It was a typo.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Twice. Agent Scully, what about the body you found. Did you establish a cause of death?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, sir. The subject, Edward Van Blundht senior, died of natural causes... specifically heart disease and advanced age.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: We think the son hid the father in the attic so he could continue to cash in on the old man's social security checks.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Most likely.

speaker: SKINNER
line: So the son wasn't a murderer?

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: Oh no, not at all.

speaker: SKINNER
line: But he was a rapist.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I entered him into the national sex offenders database. The West Virginia state police have a photo and a description and they will coordinate with local authorities. There should be an arrest soon.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: That about wraps it up.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: So Scully, what are you doing tonight? Any big plans?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, seeing as how it's Friday, I was thinking I could get some work in on that monograph I'm writing for the penology review.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: Oh.

speaker: SCULLY
line: "Diminished Acetylcholine Production in Recidivist Offenders".

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: Uh huh.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Though actually I might bag that though.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: Really?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, I have to say, Mulder, the anomalous musculature in the corpse we found really has me intrigued. In fact, I think I'm gonna go to Quantico and have some tissue samples run. I'll see you Monday.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: Monday morning.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: Fox? Brother.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: Good night! This is where my tax dollars go? Where do I live?

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: Where the hell do I sleep?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Mulder. Langly. You gotta see this. An online associate of ours, who will remain anonymous, has figured out a way to digitize the Zapruder footage so he can extrapolate a birds eye view of the Dealey plaza at the exact moment of the assassination. You'll never believe where the third shot came from.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Tell him about the cheese steaks.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Oh yeah! Frohike, Byers and me are going out for cheese steaks. Are you down with that? Uh, erase this when you hear it.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: Geeks for friends.

speaker: CHANTAL
line: Hello Marty? Chantal. It's been so long since we've spoken and I've been so lonely not hearing your sexy voice. Marty, just for you we've lowered our rates to 40 cents a minute, 2.99 for the first minute, all long distance rates apply. Do give me a call, lover-man. I'll be waiting.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: FBI. F-B-I... FBI.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: You looking at me? There ain't nobody else here, you must be lookin' at me. You want a piece of this?

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: You're a damn good looking man.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what's up?

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: Scully? Is this a bad time?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. No uh...come on in. Who's that for?

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: Uh...us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay. Have a seat.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: So uh...what are you working on?

speaker: SCULLY
line: More autopsy data. You know, everyone at the lab found Mr Van Blundht pretty fascinating. We discovered an additional anomaly related to the hair follicles in his scalp. I can't even begin to guess at the nature of it until we can run it through the transmission electron microscope.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: Sounds very interesting.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, it is. So seriously Mulder, what's going on? You okay?

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: Mm. I was just kind of knocking around, I was just thinking... Uh, good. We never really...uh...talk much...do we?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean like...really talk? No, no we don't, Mulder.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: Well what's stopping us?

speaker: SCULLY
line: So there we are at two o'clock in the morning, me and my moire taffeta dress and Marcus in whatever the hell it was he was wearing - thank you very much. It had a um... a kelly green cummerbund on it. Anyway, so, I know that Marcus is thinking that it's now or never, and I'm thinking...

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: What are you thinking?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm thinking "what is that siren I hear getting louder?"

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: No way! Who called the cops?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It wasn't the cops it was the fire department. My friend Sylvia and her idiot prom date...

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: Berwood?

speaker: SCULLY
line: ... had built this campfire that went totally out of control and so we all had to ride back on the um... what do you call it? The um, the pumper truck. Yeah. Marcus was the twelfth grade love of my life. I can't believe I'm telling you this!

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: I don't believe you haven't told me before.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I'm seeing a whole new side of you, Mulder.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: Is that a good thing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I like it.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: Do you ever wish things were different?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: The person you wanted to be when you grew up, when you were in high school. How far off from that did you end up?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Career wise? Miles off target.

speaker: EDDIE AS MULDER
line: No, no, not just that. Do you ever wish...that you could go back and do it all differently?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you?

speaker: EDDIE
line: Thanks for coming.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's with the hat?

speaker: EDDIE
line: My court-appointed therapist makes me wear it. She says it's meant to bolster my self-esteem.

speaker: MULDER
line: Does it?

speaker: EDDIE
line: Not really. The other inmates just beat me up and take it from me. Which would be okay except that every week she brings me a new hat. Plus they keep me on some kind of muscle relaxant so I can't make faces the way I used to. Did you tell them to do that? Is uh... is Agent Scully here?

speaker: MULDER
line: What did you want to talk to me about, Eddie?

speaker: EDDIE
line: I just think it's funny. I was born a loser, but you're one by choice.

speaker: MULDER
line: On what do you base that astute assessment?

speaker: EDDIE
line: Experience. You should live a little. Treat yourself. God knows I would if I were you.

speaker: GUARD
line: Good day, sir.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't imagine you need to be told this Mulder, but you're not a loser.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but I'm no Eddie Van Blundht either. Am I?
